creator: m4341@abc.se
text:
The tar task generates some error at the end of the archive, which causes some
buggy tar implementations to complain or do unexpected things. Namely busybox
suffers from the garbage at the end of the archive where the garbage causes it
to overwrite some files with incomplete data. Possibly other tar's around also
has problems with this data. (I haven't seen them yet.)

Current workaround is to unpack and re-pack with external tar program, but
that's cumbersome.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
You should probably add more information until we have enough to be able to
reproduce the problem.  Such as:  a sample buildfile that creates a tar with the
named problem (even if that is _any_ Ant-generated tar every bit you can do is
helpful).  Information as to _which_ 'buggy tar implementations' 'complain or do
unexpected things', as well as _what_ complaints they issue/unexpected things
they do, is also necessary.  Finally, if you feel these events take place with
"buggy tar implementations," what would you expect Ant to do about _them_?
